alert.note: Alert for Windham (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 11 at 3:38AM EDT until July 12 at 5:00AM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern Vermont, including the following counties, Bennington and Windham. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Ongoing flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 331 AM EDT, while the majority of the rain has ended, river rises are still possible due to lingering runoff and water routing. Heed road closures from local authorities. - Some locations that are likely experiencing flooding include... Bennington, Brattleboro, Bellows Falls, Arlington, Londonderry, Townshend, Manchester, Stratton, Putney, Vernon, Wilmington, Stamford, Readsboro, Saxtons River, Westminster, Newfane, West Wardsboro, Manchester Center, Guilford Center and Windham. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report flooding to the National Weather Service by email at ALB.stormreport@noaa.gov... On Facebook at www.facebook.com/nwsalbany or twitter @nwsalbany.
